projects.title: CMU 18-797 Course Project, Blind Source Separation
projects.bodyText:
Based on biological principles, we recognized that different Motor Units (MUs) possess unique peak characteristics.
Therefore, the key to identifying different MUs lies in the detection and analysis of these peaks.

This project includes signal filtering, peak detection, principal component analysis (PCA), K-means clustering, and dynamic time warping (DTW) analysis.

projects.title: AV-F1TENTH-Labs
projects.bodyText:
- Implemented AEB, Wall Following (based on PID controller), and Pure Pursuit control methods.
 - Implemented Gap Following and RRT Planning algorithm.
 - Implemented Model Predictive Control based on a kinematic bicycle model.

projects.title: CMU 15-640 Course Project
projects.bodyText:
- Implemented RPC.
 - Implemented a File-Caching Proxy with LRU replacement policy, open-close session semantics, and version control.
 - Implemented a simple 3-tier scalable web service.
 - Finally, implemented a 2PC protocol distributed transaction system.

projects.title: Modular Robot: EigenBot under Distributed Control
projects.bodyText:
- Implemented the curve walking algorithm in CoppeliaSim, inspired by six-leg insects' behavior, based on a biologically inspired distributed control framework.
 - Developed Eigenbot EEPROM parameters auto-setting tools, accelerating Hexapod gaits tuning process.
 - Tested the firmware, debugged the modules' communication protocol & redesigned topology structure to ensure the robot's stability and reliability.
 - Built the terrain, setup motion capture system, & recorded motion data.

projects.title: MMPUG, Multi-Model Perception Uber Good
projects.bodyText:
- Implemented A* & Theta* global planner with 2.5D orientation optimization for MMPUG architecture.
 - Integrated features to make the planner adaptive to dynamic obstacles and ensure a safety distance for the robots.
Tested the global planner both in simulation and in the real environment.

projects.title: CMU 15-645 Personal Project BusTub - A Relational DBMS
projects.bodyText:
- Implemented LRU-K policy, a disk scheduler and a buffer pool in the storage manager.
Implemented disk-backed hash index in the DB system, using a variant of extendible hashing as the hashing scheme.
 - Created the operator executors that execute SQL queries and implemented optimizer rules to transform query plans.
 - Added transaction support by implementing optimistic multi-version concurrency control.

projects.title: Undergraduate Research, Unsupervised Backdoor Attack on GNNs
projects.bodyText:
- Proposed a novel unsupervised backdoor attack method on Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) without any target label information, inspired by MoCo.
 - Implemented the proposed method on the Cora dataset and achieved a high attack success rate on Downstream Graph Classification Task.
 - Conducted extensive experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

projects.title: CMU 18-675 Course Project, LLM-based Robot Arm Control
projects.bodyText:
- Developed a robotic manipulation system for the UR5e robot arm, incorporating Large Language Model processing for real-time, natural language user commands
 - The final demo included RRT as the planner and LQR as the controller to control the robot arm to pick and place objects after interpreting the user command with the awareness of the simulation environment.
 - The future work contains integrating additional control techniques to enhance manipulation accuracy and adaptability and refining LLM-based interaction capabilities to ensure efficient command interpretation across a wide range of operational contexts.

projects.title: CMU 16-745-Optimal-Control Course Labs
projects.bodyText:
- Applied Karush-Kuhn-Tucker (KKT) conditions and Newton's method for constrained optimization, including Lagrangian methods for Quadratic Programming (QP)
 - Developed a LQR controller for nonlinear systems and developed a Model Predictive Control (MPC) approach for rendezvous and docking problems.
 - Implemented iLQR for quadrotor trajectory following and used IPOPT for safety distance constrained optimization.
 - Implemented Iterative Learning Control (ILC) for a bicycle model.
 - Designed and optimized hybrid systems for a biped walker.

projects.title: CMU 18-746: SSD Customized Flash Translation Layer
projects.bodyText:
- The FTL is designed to manage logical-to-physical address mappings, handle block metadata, and perform garbage collection and wear-leveling to ensure efficient, reliable, and endurable flash memory usage. Optimized the FTL with the page-level mapping scheme, compressed metadata storage, and a greedy wear leveling policy to reach minimized write amplification, lower memory cost, and better endurance.
 - In previous checkpoints of this project, designed and implemented a Hybrid Log-Block mapping FTL for the simulated SSD. Additionally, benchmarked various Garbage Collection Policies such as Round Robin, LRU, LFS Cost-Benefit.
